subsection_header_4: Egypt. A 38-year-old woman from Asyut province was diagnosed with bird flu after being hospitalized with a fever and bad cough on March 14. It is thought that she contracted the disease through contact with dead poultry. This is the 59th case of bird flu in Egypt.
subsection_content_4: Vietnam. A three-year-old boy from Dong Thap province tested positive for H5N1 bird flu. There are conflicting reports on how the boy was exposed; the family may have raised chickens that died recently. There are also duck farms near his home that have been affected by H5N1.  The boy had eaten either the chicken or duck prior to developing symptoms. He died on Mar 19.  Four people have been infected with bird flu in Vietnam this year and the virus has been blamed for two deaths.
subsection_content_3: Egypt. A 38-year-old woman from Asyut province was diagnosed with bird flu after being hospitalized with a fever and bad cough on March 14. It is thought that she contracted the disease through contact with dead poultry. This is the 59th case of bird flu in Egypt.
subsection_content_2: Bangladesh. Bird flu has been detected in a poultry farm in the village of Rampur in Netrakona District.  The district Livestock Office said that dozens of birds that died over the last week have tested positive. Officials culled 1,595 chickens and 205 eggs.
